name: Mobius (for Oculus Go)
description:
Mobius is a video installation, "remastered" for VR.

A man trapped in a never-ending loop: a film shown on four screens arranged in a cube. Audiences, viewing from within, watch the looping film unfold. Each screen’s playback is delayed by 25% as the one next to it. The story temporally interacts with itself screen to screen.

This video installation was originally mounted on October 1st, 2009 at Toronto’s Eaton Centre from 10AM to 9:30PM, and again on October 3rd, 2009, from sunset to sunrise the next morning as a part of Toronto’s annual Scotiabank Nuit Blanche in Cabbagetown.

For more information, please visit: www.jleaverpresentations.com/mobius

Instructions
Best experienced sitting in an office chair, so you can turn 360­°. Use headphones for full spatial sound experience.

To move, touch the top of the Oculus Go touchpad to move forward, the bottom to go backward, etc. The closer to the edge of the touchpad you press, the fast you go. Click the touchpad to amplify speed.

Credits
Produced and Directed by Jason Leaver
Written by Blair Renaud
Starring Will Conlon
Music by Adrian Ellis
